column7: NOTE: "P.H. Chada" is an entirely ficticious individual. According to Wikipedia, チャダ is a loose anagram of あだち, the actual scriptwriter('s alias), with "P.H." possibly standing for "Prince Hiroi" = 広井王子, the director.
NOTE: and of course there is also no such "original work"
NOTE: mobygames claims this is an alias of Oji Hiroi, but every Japanese source I can find indicates they're different people
NOTE: god, did Red Company just put her in every game they made?

NOTE: seems to be a typo of マニピュレーター. this is apparently a wasei-eigo term that means things like "synthesizer programmer", but since there's another section below which explicitly credits the "sound programmers", I'm not sure what these people's job actually was. Given that, I'll just go with Japanese Wikipedia's more generic suggestion of "sound creator" for now.

column5: システム・プログラム

column7: NOTE: this guy's name appears in the august 1989 issue of Gekkan PC Engine, and the reading for his first name is listed as "Tetsu" rather than "Satoshi". this seems to be a mistake, however, as he's listed on numerous internationally-released games (e.g. pokemon card gb) as "Satoshi".

column5: サウンド・プログラム
アニメーション・デザイン

column7: NOTE: mobygames lists this one guy with an "ou" instead of a macron vowel for some reason; dropping it for consistency

column5: テクニカル・スタッフ
スペシャル　サンクス

column7: NOTE: listed on mobygames as "Tokyo Movie Shinbun" for some wacky reason
NOTE: ryuichi sakamoto's independent music label around the time this game was released (thanks to zenki for figuring this one out)

column5: ミュージカル・プラン

column7: NOTE: I've modified the credits to put these in English alphabetical order for the translation.
NOTE: pretty sure I spelled this guy's name as "Ouji" throughout the Galaxy Fraulein Yuna series. oh well.
